meanings.definition: A timid, meek, or ineffectual person.
meanings.sent1: The nebbish quietly sat in the corner during the party.
meanings.sent2: She always felt like a nebbish when speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The nebbish tried to speak up but was too shy to make a sound.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bold lions, he was just a nebbish mouse.
meanings.sent5: His nebbish nature made him an easy target for bullies.

meanings.definition: A pitifully ineffectual, luckless, or unfortunate person.
meanings.sent1: The poor nebbish could never catch a break in life.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a nebbish when everything seemed to go wrong at once.
meanings.sent3: Despite his efforts, he always ended up being the nebbish in every situation.
meanings.sent4: In the game of luck, he was the ultimate nebbish with no winning streak.
meanings.sent5: His friends always joked that he was the nebbish of the group, never catching a break.
